basic_info.title: SQUID Token
basic_info.tagline: Play to Earn Crypto inspired by Squid Game
basic_info.description: SQUID is a token inspired by the popular Netflix series Squid Game. Claim to be a play-to-earn gaming platform where users can participate in games similar to the show and earn SQUID tokens. Website and social media disappeared after rug pull.

founders.name: Anonymous
founders.bio: No verifiable information about founders. All team members anonymous. No LinkedIn profiles, no public backgrounds.

product.description: Claimed to be developing play-to-earn games inspired by Squid Game series. Token launched with ANTI-SELL MECHANISM - users could buy but could not sell. This was explained as 'anti-dump mechanism' but was actually honeypot. No actual game was ever developed or shown.
technology: Malicious smart contract with sell restrictions

market.target: Retail investors attracted by Squid Game hype and promise of easy gains

media: BBC: 'Squid Game cryptocurrency scam sees millions vanish'
CoinDesk: 'Squid Game Token Crashes After Suspected Rug Pull'
Bloomberg: 'Squid Game crypto scam highlights risks'
All major crypto news outlets warned about it

extracted_text:
ðŸš¨ CRITICAL RED FLAGS DETECTED ðŸš¨

1. ANTI-SELL MECHANISM: Token contract prevented users from selling. Only team could sell.

2. ANONYMOUS TEAM: Zero verifiable information about developers or team members.

3. FAKE PARTNERSHIPS: Claimed Netflix partnership which was completely false.

4. RUG PULL: +40,000% pump followed by -99.99% crash. Team sold everything, removed liquidity, deleted social media.

5. NO PRODUCT: Despite claims of play-to-earn gaming platform, zero evidence of any actual game development.

6. HONEYPOT CONTRACT: Smart contract designed to trap funds. Users could deposit but not withdraw.

7. DISAPPEARED: Website, Twitter, Telegram all deleted immediately after rug pull.

8. MILLIONS LOST: Investors lost millions of dollars in hours.

TYPICAL RUG PULL PATTERN:
- Hype around trending topic (Squid Game)
- Anonymous team
- Fake partnerships
- Anti-sell mechanism
- Pump via fake news
- Dump everything
- Delete all traces
- Disappear with money

This is a TEXTBOOK SCAM. Avoid at all costs. Anyone promoting similar projects should be treated with extreme suspicion.
